title: Firefox 97.0 (Linux version) and previous version CREATES noise in whatever audio is running.
content: Firefox 97 and previous version CREATES noise in whatever audio is running. Whether it is audio from Audacious, my music player, or audio from the program I am watching on Firefox. How can I stop the noise, which sounds like static from a week station on an old AM radio? Using other browser does not have this audio problem, UNLESS Firefox is running. Even if not actively using Firefox, just having it open on the desktop causes noise. Using Linux Mint 20 64bit. Audio produced by motherboard ASUS Prime B550 Plus with AMD Ryzen 9 3900X processor. Clicking on Firefox Help gets a message saying "Updates disabled by your system administrator" along with the normal text. I didn't disable updates and I am the Admin.
creator: love390520

title: just got new update and now I can't print my AOL mail, HELP!
content: Tell me how to get my printing started again, since the new update was done about 2 hours ago(2/13/22). Won't print full page.
creator: CaliforniaLady

title: Print Preview
content: How can I change back to Firefox version 96.0.3 so I can have Print Preview with sizing options again? Is that possible? I need the options to change size, etc. before printing some pages. Is there any other solution?

title: Firefox Nightly Pausing Visuals on Video When Overlayed by Another Program
content:
Hi there! I use a transparent version of Discord so I can watch videos through the client on Firefox while using Discord itself. This used to not be an issue at all, but at some point recently, Nightly had an update that stopped me from being able to do this by pausing the video's visuals a few seconds after I tab into Discord. My theory is that it's to save resources in performance, but I'd like to figure out how to revert this so I can do what I did previously. example

Things tried so far: hardware acceleration on/off using different types of video outside of Firefox to make sure it wasn't Discord/Windows freezing it different websites besides YouTube to make sure it wasn't YouTube freezing it

Thank you in advance for your time and help! :)
creator: CutieeCeleste

title: Encrytion Issues with HTTPS
content:
have you forced Firefox to only use HTTPS (dom.security.https_only_mode = true) ?

...If you have set the latter then you need to reset this pref on the about:config page. ( I don't understand this answer from your contributor.)

Chase Bank webpage will not fully let me log in.
creator: Lindahalt

title: Unable to review or rate add-ons
content:
When I display the review page for any installed add-on, I'm unable to submit a review. A few details:

1) I do not see the expected, "Rate Your Experience" link 2) I'm logged onto my Firefox account 3) I'm aware it uses different credentials than Mozilla Support 4) I've tried clicking on the yellow stars but it doesn't allow me to rate the plug in or display any new links 5) I've read other forum posts from other users who've experienced the same symptoms

Ideas, anyone? Thanks,

- Fido
creator: FidoFidoFido

title: Firefox oplvida las ventanas de la ultima sesion
content: Trabajo con 7 ventanas abiertas y antes se guardaban cuando cerraba, pero ahora parece que se olvida de ellas, pues cuando abro el navegador solo abre 3 de las 7 que se supone que se habían guardado, y no aparece en la sección de ventanas cerradas y no se a que se debe que de repente las olvide a la hora de abrir el navegador
creator: iv_alexin350
